newsitem.title: USA: NYS legislature seen approving contingency budget.
newsitem.headline: NYS legislature seen approving contingency budget.

text.p: The New York State legislature looked set to approve by Wednesday Gov. George Pataki's contingency budget and close ahead of schedule for the Good Friday holiday, a legislative source said Tuesday.

The source, who declined to be named, explained that the legislature had planned to work on Thursday, but now hoped to send the $9.9 billion contingency budget to the governor by Wednesday, and begin heading home two days before the Good Friday holiday on March 28.

Pataki, whose Administration last year set a national record for late budgets by failing to get a pact until 104 days after it was due, has proposed a contingency budget to fund the government from April 1 through May 9. The state faces an April 1 deadline for its new, fiscal 1998 budget.
The Republican governor has blamed the need for a contingency budget squarely on the Assembly, which is led by Democrats, saying its wanted to increase spending by far too much.

"I would have preferred to have a budget in place by April 1 but I will not sign a budget that recklessly spends $3 billion to $4 billion moe than I have proposed and returns us to the failed policies of the late 1980s and early 1990s," Pataki said, in a prepared statement released on Monday.
